org.transitime.core

Class SpatialMatch

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.transitime.core.SpatialMatch
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    TemporalMatch

    public class SpatialMatch
extends java.lang.Object
    Describes where an AVL report matches to an assignment spatially.
    Author:
    SkiBu Smith

        Member Functions

      • SpatialMatch

        public SpatialMatch(SpatialMatch toCopy,
            Trip newTrip)
        For making a copy of the SpatialMatch but for a new trip. This is useful when doing things by TripPattern, such as spatial matching. Can then make copies for the other trips that use that TripPattern.
        Parameters:
        toCopy - The SpatialMatch to copy (except for the trip info)
        newTrip - The new trip to use for the copy

      • SpatialMatch

        public SpatialMatch(SpatialMatch toCopy,
            org.transitime.core.Indices newIndices,
            double distanceAlongSegment)
        Constructs a new SpatialMatch but at the new indices specified. Useful for create a match that is just before or after a stop, which is useful for determining travel time from stop to the next match.
        Parameters:
        toCopy -
        newIndices -
        distanceAlongSegment -

    • Method Detail

      • distanceFromBeginningOfTrip

        public double distanceFromBeginningOfTrip()
        Returns distance of this match from the beginning of the trip.
        Returns:

      • awayFromTerminals

        public boolean awayFromTerminals(double distance)
        Determines if this SpatialMatch is further away then the specified distance from the terminal at the beginning and end of the trip. This can be useful when doing things like matching a vehicle to a route where one needs to first be sure that the vehicle is not at a terminal because at the terminal one cannot determine appropriate spatial match.
        Parameters:
        distance -
        Returns:
        True if match is further away than distance away from terminals of trip

      • withinDistanceOfEndOfTrip

        public boolean withinDistanceOfEndOfTrip(double distance)
        Returns whether this SpatialMatch is within the specified distance along the path from the end of the trip.
        Parameters:
        distance -
        Returns:
        True if within distance of end of trip.

      • isLastTripOfBlock

        public boolean isLastTripOfBlock()
        Returns whether the trip for this match is the last trip of the block.

      • atEndOfPathStop

        public boolean atEndOfPathStop()
        Returns true if the match is to the stop at the end of the stop path. This can be important because atStop can also be set to the previous stop, which is something very different. If match is not for at a stop then null is returned.
        Returns:
        True if match is for at stop at end of stop path

      • atBeginningOfPathStop

        public boolean atBeginningOfPathStop()
        Returns true if the match is to the stop for the previous stop path. This can be important because atStop can also be set to the stop for the current stop path, which is very different. If match is not for at a stop then null is returned.
        Returns:
        True if match is for stop for the previous stop path

      • getMatchAdjustedToEndOfPath

        public SpatialMatch getMatchAdjustedToEndOfPath()
        For when need to determine arrival time when vehicle matches to a stop. Returns a SpatialMatch that corresponds to the end of the stop path for the stop indicated by the current SpatialMatch. If the match is for stop for the previous stop path (the vehicle is matching to just beyond the stop) the the previous stop path is used. Only to be called when vehicle is matched to a stop. Logs error and returns null if match is not for at a stop.
        Returns:
        SpatialMatch adjusted so it is at end of path for the stop

      • getMatchAdjustedToBeginningOfPath

        public SpatialMatch getMatchAdjustedToBeginningOfPath()
        For when need to determine departure time at a stop. Returns a SpatialMatch that corresponds to the beginning of the next stop path for the stop indicated by the current SpatialMatch. Only to be called when vehicle is matched to a stop. Logs error and returns null if match is not for at a stop.
        Returns:
        SpatialMatch adjusted so it is at beginning of path for the stop

      • getMatchAtJustBeforeNextStop

        public SpatialMatch getMatchAtJustBeforeNextStop()
        Returns a SpatialMatch that corresponds to just before the next stop. Useful if need to determine travel time to next stop.
        Returns:

      • getMatchBeforeStopIfAtStop

        public SpatialMatch getMatchBeforeStopIfAtStop()
        Returns a SpatialMatch that corresponds to the current match but will be moved to before a stop if the current match is just after the stop. This way can pass in this modified match to the methods that determine travel time and the layover/stop time for the stop where the SpatialMatch is will not be included in the calculations. If the current object is not just after a stop then the original object is returned.
        Returns:
        This match or one before the stop if at beginning of stop path

      • getMatchAtPreviousStop

        public SpatialMatch getMatchAtPreviousStop()
        Returns a SpatialMatch that corresponds to the previous stop. The returned match will be just before the previous stop. Useful if need to determine travel time from previous stop.
        Returns:
        The SpatialMatch for the previous stop, or null if there is no previous stop (the current match is for the beginning of the block).

      • isLayover

        public boolean isLayover()
        A layover stop is when a vehicle can leave route path before departing this stop since the driver is taking a break.
        Returns:
        true if this spatial match is for a layover

      • isWaitStop

        public boolean isWaitStop()
        Wait stop is when a vehicle is not supposed to depart the stop until the scheduled departure time.
        Returns:
        true if this spatial match is for a waitStop

      • getScheduledWaitStopTime

        public int getScheduledWaitStopTime()
        Returns the scheduled time vehicle is to leave the stop.
        Returns:
        the scheduled time vehicle is to leave the stop. Time is seconds into day.

      • getDistanceAlongStopPath

        public double getDistanceAlongStopPath()
        Travel distance along current path.
        Returns:

      • getDistanceRemainingInStopPath

        public double getDistanceRemainingInStopPath()
        How far still to travel to end of path.
        Returns:

      • getIndicesForDistanceBeforeMatch

        public org.transitime.core.Indices getIndicesForDistanceBeforeMatch(double distanceBeforeMatch)
        Determines the indices for the position the specified distance before this match. Useful for seeing if looking how far past a stop the match is.
        Parameters:
        distanceBeforeMatch -
        Returns:

      • lessThanOrEqualTo

        public boolean lessThanOrEqualTo(SpatialMatch other)
        Returns true if this is before or equal to the other SpatialMatch passed in.
        Parameters:
        other - The Spatial Match to compare to
        Returns:
        true if this is before or equal to the other SpatialMatch

      • numberStopsBetweenMatches

        public static int numberStopsBetweenMatches(SpatialMatch match1,
                            SpatialMatch match2)
        Returns the total number of stops traversed between the two matches.
        Parameters:
        match1 -
        match2 -
        Returns:
        Number of stops

      • getIndices

        public org.transitime.core.Indices getIndices()
        Returns copy of the indices of the match as an Indices object. The Indices object is newly created and independent so it can be changed (incremented and decremented) at will.
        Returns:

      • getAtStop

        public VehicleAtStopInfo getAtStop()
        Can be either at stop at beginning of the stop path or at the stop at the end of the stop path.
        Returns:
        VehicleAtStopInfo object containing trip and path index of stop that match is nearby. Returns null if match is not near a stop.

      • getAtEndStop

        public VehicleAtStopInfo getAtEndStop()
        Returns the VehicleAtStopInfo if match indicates that vehicle is at the stop at the end of the path.
        Returns:
        VehicleAtStopInfo if vehicle at stop at end of stop path. Otherwise null.

      • getAtBeginningStop

        public VehicleAtStopInfo getAtBeginningStop()
        Returns the VehicleAtStopInfo if match indicates that vehicle is at the stop at the beginning of the path.
        Returns:
        VehicleAtStopInfo if vehicle at stop at beginning of stop path. Otherwise null.

      • isAtStop

        public boolean isAtStop()
        Returns true if vehicle is at or near a stop. Can be either at stop at beginning of the stop path or at the stop at the end of the stop path.
        Returns:
        true if vehicle is at or near a stop.

      • isAtStop

        public boolean isAtStop(int tripIndex,
               int stopPathIndex)
        Returns true if this match indicates that the vehicle is at the stop indicated by the tripIndex and stopPathIndex parameters.
        Parameters:
        tripIndex -
        stopPathIndex -
        Returns:
        True if at specified stop
